nodes.bodyText:
{{.PublisherID}} is not parsed by java. (It is used in GO for variable)
Remove this, and add test for validate right endpoint url creation.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,24 @@
+adapters:
+  smartrtb:
+    enabled: false
+    endpoint: http://market-east.smrtb.com/json/publisher/rtb?pubid={{.PublisherID}}

nodes.bodyText:
There are redirect url
https://github.com/prebid/prebid-server/pull/1071/files#diff-3baf47c64847a8fb8aaa8cc2e088513bR521
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,24 @@
+adapters:
+  smartrtb:
+    enabled: false
+    endpoint: http://market-east.smrtb.com/json/publisher/rtb?pubid={{.PublisherID}}
+    pbs-enforces-gdpr: true
+    modifying-vast-xml-allowed: true
+    deprecated-names:
+    aliases:
+    meta-info:
+      maintainer-email: "engineering@smrtb.com"
+      app-media-types:
+        - banner
+        - video
+      site-media-types:
+        - banner
+        - video
+      supported-vendors:
+      vendor-id: 0
+    usersync:
+      url:
+      redirect-url:

nodes.bodyText: pub_id
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,27 @@
+{
+  "$schema": "http://json-schema.org/draft-04/schema#",
+  "title": "SmartRTB Adapter Params",
+  "description": "A schema which validates params accepted by SmartRTB adapter",
+  "type": "object",
+  "properties": {
+    "publisherId": {
+      "type": "string",
+      "description": "Assigned publisher ID",
+      "minLength": 4
+    },
+    "mediaId": {
+      "type": "string",
+      "description": "Property ID not zone ID not provided"
+    },
+    "zoneId": {
+      "type": "string",
+      "description": "Specific zone ID for this placement, belonging to app/site",
+      "minLength": 20
+    },
+    "forceBid": {
+      "type": "boolean",
+      "description": "Force bids with a test creative"
+    }
+  },
+  "required": [ "publisherId" ]

nodes.bodyText: It seems to be better name "publisherId" than just "pub_id" ?

nodes.bodyText:
This json schema is used for parameter validation.
In GO they have absolutely identical schema, so you can just copy form there.
It is not our decision how this parameters will be named in a received request.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,27 @@
+{
+  "$schema": "http://json-schema.org/draft-04/schema#",
+  "title": "SmartRTB Adapter Params",
+  "description": "A schema which validates params accepted by SmartRTB adapter",
+  "type": "object",
+  "properties": {
+    "publisherId": {
+      "type": "string",
+      "description": "Assigned publisher ID",
+      "minLength": 4
+    },
+    "mediaId": {
+      "type": "string",
+      "description": "Property ID not zone ID not provided"
+    },
+    "zoneId": {
+      "type": "string",

+    }
+  },

nodes.bodyText:
Keep schema from GO. Change all variable appropriately
pub_id
Arrange method, according to workflow chain.
Inline return
Method arrangement

SmartRtb actually.
And you can remove unnecessary comments
There are no such validation in GO. They just skip imp, but it seems fine for me

They don't throw an exception in case of empty pub.
They use req.ext.pubId = imp.ext.pubId  and only after that, they validate on blank
I don't like their approach.
They always pass request.ext to method to always check for it emptiness, and just insert first pubId from imp.ext.pub_id.
Mb you can find more cleaner way to do this
They don't have this logic in GO

url after this:
?rtb={.PublisherId}/123
must be ?rtb=123
Add tests for this

You cant just take appology bidder, and keep all the logic.
There are no corresponding code in go
Inline this in makeHttpRequests method  return

They also add
	headers.Add("x-openrtb-version", "2.5")
They use different matching value for the imp type. (bid.ext.format) and then clear it. See json test in GO.

There are different json schema in GO
https://github.com/prebid/prebid-server/pull/1071/files#diff-2e15ff207617219a445f7aeac3e7438dR26
Add an empty line after last } in ALL .java files
Remove unnecessary parameters for ALL tests
false
Make variable, and name it appropriately
false
Make test url more similar to production url
Redundant
They have different type matching
Change to use Type from ext
false
base 64 encode. And change appropriately to your bidder.
remove
Add header x-openrtb-version
You don't have request per imp. So this is also will be removed
They gather all parsed imps and create only one request.
You can omit explicit naming for Jackson bc we have special settings that rename "pubId" to "pub_id"
same. You can omit explicit naming for Jackson bc we have special settings that rename "pubId" to "pub_id"
use isBlank methods.
I did not find corresponding logic in GO

You don't need this values.
They insert only pubId in req.ext

You need to change default behavior of makeBids method.
Please see TripleliftBidder.makeBids to have an idea how to do this.
False
What are you testing in this case ?
Ctrl + Alt + L
Add test for validate 'req.ext' change.
